title: Catacombs of Kourend

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Catacombs of Kourend is a massive dungeon located beneath Great Kourend. The main entrance is found by investigating the statue of King Rada I in the courtyard of Kourend Castle. The fastest way to the main entrance is through Xeric's talisman with the "Xeric's Heart" function, which teleports the player outside the statue of King Rada I, requiring completion of the Architectural Alliance miniquest, or the Kourend Castle Teleport spell, which requires finding and reading the book Transportation incantations from the Arceuus Library. Alternatively, a portal in the portal chamber or portal nexus of a player-owned house attuned to Kourend Castle can be used instead.

content:
"Catas" redirects here. For other uses, see Catablepon or Catacombs (disambiguation).
"Cok" redirects here. For the quest, see Client of Kourend.
Catacombs of Kourend
Released9 June 2016 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors1
LocationGreat Kourend
InhabitantsVaries
MusicBeneath the Kingdom
Map
Advanced data
Typedungeon

The Catacombs of Kourend is a massive dungeon located beneath Great Kourend. The main entrance is found by investigating the statue of King Rada I in the courtyard of Kourend Castle. The fastest way to the main entrance is through Xeric's talisman with the "Xeric's Heart" function, which teleports the player outside the statue of King Rada I, requiring completion of the Architectural Alliance miniquest, or the Kourend Castle Teleport spell, which requires finding and reading the book Transportation incantations from the Arceuus Library. Alternatively, a portal in the portal chamber or portal nexus of a player-owned house attuned to Kourend Castle can be used instead.

Catacombs of Kourend entrances - Must be unlocked by climbing up the vines from within the Catacombs.

There are five other entrances to the catacombs - three scattered around the surface of Great Kourend and two further entrances connecting to other dungeons on Great Kourend (Forthos Dungeon and Giants' Den, respectively). However, these additional entrances will only appear once the player has climbed the respective vines from inside the Catacombs. The vines connecting to the surface are located in the dungeon map to the right, marked with a icon.

The Catacombs of Kourend were created by Skotizo during the God Wars by using an artefact stolen from the Karamjan Temple.[1] The Catacombs are said to belong in another realm,[2] while also being beneath the kingdom.[3] The Catacombs are also enchanted with powerful magic that prevents the monsters within from escaping;[4] conversely, it is supposedly difficult for "mere mortals" to enter the Catacombs as well, though players can enter the area without issues.

Contents

  • 1 Features
    • 1.1 Demon's Run
    • 1.2 Dragon's Den
    • 1.3 Reeking Cove
    • 1.4 The Shallows
    • 1.5 Skotizo
  • 2 References

Features[edit | edit source]

The Catacombs contains many monsters that are commonly assigned to players for slayer tasks, and are slightly stronger compared to those found elsewhere on Gielinor. As this particular dungeon is a multicombat area (excluding the brutal dragon area), it is generally recommended to use Prayer or high-healing methods for aggressive high-level monsters stacked against the player. In addition, dwarf multicannons cannot be placed inside the Catacombs. If players attempt to place one, the chatbox will state "The influence of the dark altar prevents your cannon being set up here."

A special effect of the Catacombs is that players who bury bones of any type within it will have a small amount of their prayer points restored. This also applies if the bones are crushed via the bonecrusher, although the prayer restoration effect of the bonecrusher necklace does not stack. Note scattering demonic ashes does not restore prayer points - only bones.

  • Bones restore 1 prayer point.
  • Big bones restore 2 prayer points.
  • Dragon bones restore 4 prayer points.

There are also a few agility shortcuts around the dungeon, the highest of them requiring 34 Agility. These shortcuts are found in the following areas:

  • Southern Crevice: Two-way shortcut between cyclops and ankous. Requires 17 Agility.
  • Stepping stones: Two-way shortcut between the steel dragon and brutal red dragon area. Requires 28 Agility. Each stepping stone must be clicked on to jump to it. Steel/brutal red dragons can attack players while using the shortcut.
  • Northern Crevice: Two-way shortcut between warped jellies and greater nechryael. Requires 34 Agility.

The dark altar in the main entrance of the catacombs can be used to teleport to the four sections of the Catacombs; doing so requires using an ancient shard, which is obtained from monsters in the catacombs.

Demon's Run[edit | edit source]

The Demon's Run.

The Demon's Run is the north-eastern section of the Catacombs, where various demonic creatures can be found. The exit is found in the north-east corner with the greater demons, which leads up to the hole west of the dense essence mine.

Once the exit has been used—provided players have paid a one-off fee of 80,000 coins to Trossa—it can be quickly accessed via fairy ring cis and running east.

Dragon's Den[edit | edit source]

The Dragon's Den.

The Dragon's Den is the north-western section of the Catacombs, where various draconic creatures can be found. It is the only location where brutal blue, red and black dragons can be found. The exit is found in the north-west corner with the brutal black dragons, which leads up to a hole north of The Deeper Lode pub in Lovakengj.

Once the exit has been used, it can be quickly accessed via the "Jewellery of Jubilation" teleport on Kharedst's memoirs, which requires completion of The Forsaken Tower to use.

Reeking Cove[edit | edit source]

The Reeking Cove.

The Reeking Cove is the south-western section of the Catacombs, where various undead creatures can be found. It is the only location where deviant spectres and twisted banshees can be found. The exit is found in the southern area with the deviant spectres, which leads up to the hole north-west of the Shayzien bank.

Once the exit has been used, it can be quickly accessed via fairy ring djr and running east. Note: deviant spectres at this entrance will lower your stats if not wearing a nose peg or slayer helmet.

The Shallows[edit | edit source]

The Shallows.

The Shallows is the watery south-eastern section of the Catacombs, where various undead creatures can be found. It is the only location where warped jellies can be found. The exit is found in the south-eastern corner with the king sand crab, which leads to the western exit of the Forthos Dungeon in Hosidius. This exit also happens to be very close to an altar. To use the altar you should unlock all the doors in the Forthos Dungeon.

Once the exit has been used, it can be quickly accessed via a variety of methods, such as using a Watson teleport and running to the Forthos Ruin, the Woodcutting Guild teleport from a skills necklace or travelling to the Hosidius station of the Lovakengj Minecart Network.

Skotizo[edit | edit source]

A player uses the dark totem on the Altar in the centre of the Catacombs.

Beneath the Catacombs lurks Skotizo, a demi-boss whose lair requires the use of a dark totem to enter. Components for the dark totem are obtained by killing the monsters (excluding ghosts) throughout the catacombs. To access the lair, the totem must be used on the altar in the centre of the Catacombs.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Mount Karuulm diary, written by Karuulm, Old School RuneScape. "The arrival seems to be a demon of Zamorak, one in possession of an artefact I have never encountered. While the demon arrived alone, he has used this artefact to call upon a variety of creatures to his side."
  2. ^ Kharedst's memoirs, Old School RuneScape. "The entrance below may be below the earth, but that realm lies beyond the reach of us mere mortals."
  3. ^ Konar quo Maten, Old School RuneScape. "The Catacombs of Kourend are located beneath Great Kourend."
  4. ^ Kharedst's memoirs, Old School RuneScape. "I know of the powerful magic that keeps them bound below."

The '''Catacombs of Kourend''' is a massive [[dungeons|dungeon]] located beneath [[Great Kourend]]. The main entrance is found by investigating the [[statue of King Rada I]] in the courtyard of [[Kourend Castle]]. The fastest way to the main entrance is through [[Xeric's talisman]] with the "Xeric's Heart" function, which teleports the player outside the statue of [[King Rada I]], requiring completion of the [[Architectural Alliance]] [[miniquest]], or the [[Kourend Castle Teleport]] spell, which requires finding and reading the book [[Transportation incantations]] from the [[Arceuus Library]]. Alternatively, a portal in the [[portal chamber]] or [[portal nexus]] of a [[player-owned house]] attuned to Kourend Castle can be used instead.

{{Map|mtype=pin|width=250|height=250|align=left|caption=Catacombs of Kourend entrances - Must be unlocked by climbing up the vines from within the Catacombs.
|x:1696,y:3865,title:[[Greater demon]]s
|x:1563,y:3791,title:[[Brutal black dragon]]s
|x:1470,y:3653,title:[[Deviant spectre]]s
|x:1669,y:3567,title:[[King Sand Crab]],desc:Climb down the stairs then go through the [[Strange passage]]
|x:1639,y:3674,title:Main Entrance - Statue
}}
There are five other entrances to the catacombs - three scattered around the surface of [[Great Kourend]] and two further entrances connecting to other dungeons on Great Kourend ([[Forthos Dungeon]] and [[Giants' Den]], respectively). However, these additional entrances will only appear once the player has climbed the respective [[Vine (Catacombs of Kourend)|vines]] from inside the Catacombs. The vines connecting to the surface are located in the dungeon map to the right, marked with a [[File:Map link icon.png]] icon.

The Catacombs of Kourend were created by [[Skotizo]] during the [[God Wars]] by using an artefact stolen from the [[Karamjan Temple]].{{CiteText|text=Mount Karuulm diary|author=Karuulm|quote=The arrival seems to be a demon of Zamorak, one in possession of an artefact I have never encountered. While the demon arrived alone, he has used this artefact to call upon a variety of creatures to his side.}} The Catacombs are said to belong in another realm,{{CiteNPC|npc=Kharedst's memoirs|quote=The entrance below may be below the earth, but that realm lies beyond the reach of us mere mortals.}} while also being beneath the kingdom.{{CiteNPC|npc=Konar quo Maten|quote=The Catacombs of Kourend are located beneath Great Kourend.}} The Catacombs are also enchanted with powerful magic that prevents the monsters within from escaping;{{CiteNPC|npc=Kharedst's memoirs|quote=I know of the powerful magic that keeps them bound below.}} conversely, it is supposedly difficult for "mere mortals" to enter the Catacombs as well, though players can enter the area without issues.

==Features==
The Catacombs contains many [[Slayer monsters|monsters]] that are commonly assigned to players for [[slayer tasks]], and are slightly stronger compared to those found elsewhere on [[Gielinor]]. As this particular dungeon is a [[multicombat area]] (excluding the [[brutal dragon]] area), it is generally recommended to use [[Prayer]] or high-healing methods for [[aggressive]] high-level monsters stacked against the player. In addition, '''[[dwarf multicannon]]s cannot be placed inside the Catacombs'''. If players attempt to place one, the chatbox will state "''The influence of the dark altar prevents your cannon being set up here.''"

A special effect of the Catacombs is that players who bury [[bones]] of any type within it will have a small amount of their [[prayer points]] restored. This also applies if the bones are crushed via the [[bonecrusher]], although the prayer restoration effect of the [[bonecrusher necklace]] does not stack. ''Note scattering [[demonic ashes]] does not restore prayer points - only bones.''
*[[Bones]] restore 1 prayer point.
*[[Big bones]] restore 2 prayer points.
*[[Dragon bones]] restore 4 prayer points.

There are also a few [[agility shortcut]]s around the dungeon, the highest of them requiring 34 [[Agility]]. These shortcuts are found in the following areas:

*[[Crack (Southern Catacombs of Kourend)|Southern Crevice]]: Two-way shortcut between [[cyclops]] and [[ankous]]. Requires 17 Agility.
*[[Stones (Catacombs of Kourend)|Stepping stones]]: Two-way shortcut between the [[steel dragon]] and [[brutal red dragon]] area. Requires 28 Agility. Each stepping stone must be clicked on to jump to it. Steel/brutal red dragons can attack players while using the shortcut.
*[[Crack (Northern Catacombs of Kourend)|Northern Crevice]]: Two-way shortcut between [[warped jellies]] and [[greater nechryael]]. Requires 34 Agility.

The [[Altar (Catacombs of Kourend)|dark altar]] in the main entrance of the catacombs can be used to teleport to the four sections of the Catacombs; doing so requires using an [[ancient shard]], which is obtained from monsters in the catacombs.

===Demon's Run===
[[File:Catacombs of Kourend - Demon's Run.png|thumb|right|The Demon's Run.]]
The Demon's Run is the north-eastern section of the Catacombs, where various demonic creatures can be found. The exit is found in the north-east corner with the [[greater demon]]s, which leads up to the hole west of the [[dense essence mine]].

Once the exit has been used—provided players have paid a one-off fee of 80,000 coins to [[Trossa]]—it can be quickly accessed via [[fairy ring]] {{Fairycode|cis}} and running east.

===Dragon's Den===
[[File:Catacombs of Kourend - Dragon's Den.png|thumb|right|The Dragon's Den.]]
The Dragon's Den is the north-western section of the Catacombs, where various draconic creatures can be found. It is the only location where [[Brutal blue dragon|brutal blue]], [[Brutal red dragon|red]] and [[Brutal black dragon|black dragons]] can be found. The exit is found in the north-west corner with the [[brutal black dragon]]s, which leads up to a hole north of [[The Deeper Lode]] pub in [[Lovakengj]].

Once the exit has been used, it can be quickly accessed via the "Jewellery of Jubilation" teleport on [[Kharedst's memoirs]], which requires completion of [[The Forsaken Tower]] to use.

===Reeking Cove===
[[File:Catacombs of Kourend - Reeking Cove.png|thumb|300px|The Reeking Cove.]]
The Reeking Cove is the south-western section of the Catacombs, where various undead creatures can be found. It is the only location where [[deviant spectre]]s and [[twisted banshee]]s can be found. The exit is found in the southern area with the deviant spectres, which leads up to the hole north-west of the [[Shayzien]] bank.

Once the exit has been used, it can be quickly accessed via [[fairy ring]] {{Fairycode|djr}} and running east. Note: [[deviant spectre]]s at this entrance will lower your stats if not wearing a [[nose peg]] or [[slayer helmet]].

===The Shallows===
[[File:Catacombs of Kourend - The Shallows.png|thumb|right|The Shallows.]]
The Shallows is the watery south-eastern section of the Catacombs, where various undead creatures can be found. It is the only location where [[Warped Jelly|warped jellies]] can be found. The exit is found in the south-eastern corner with the king sand crab, which leads to the western exit of the [[Forthos Dungeon]] in [[Hosidius]]. This exit also happens to be very close to an altar. To use the altar you should unlock all the doors in the Forthos Dungeon.

Once the exit has been used, it can be quickly accessed via a variety of methods, such as using a [[Watson teleport]] and running to the [[Forthos Ruin]], the [[Woodcutting Guild]] teleport from a [[skills necklace]] or travelling to the Hosidius station of the [[Lovakengj Minecart Network]].

===Skotizo===
[[File:Using dark totem.gif|thumb|170px|A player uses the dark totem on the Altar in the centre of the Catacombs.]]
Beneath the Catacombs lurks [[Skotizo]], a [[demi-boss]] whose lair requires the use of a [[dark totem]] to enter. Components for the dark totem are obtained by killing the monsters (excluding [[ghost]]s) throughout the catacombs. To access the lair, the totem must be used on the [[Altar (Catacombs of Kourend)|altar]] in the centre of the Catacombs.
